request.description:
### üîê 1. Auth - Create Token

Description: Creates a new auth token to use for access to the PUT and DELETE /booking.

  
Use this token to unlock special powers ‚Äî like updating or deleting bookings (`PUT` and `DELETE /booking`). üîë‚ú®  

#### üì¨ Endpoint

``` bash
POST /auth

 ```

---

#### üìù Request Body

``` json
{
  "username": "admin",
  "password": "password123"
}

 ```

---

#### üì¶ Response

``` json
{
  "token": "625026321ce550d"
}

 ```

---

#### üíª Example Request (curl)

``` bash
curl --location 'https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com/auth' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data '{
  "username": "admin",
  "password": "password123"
}'


 ```

item.description:
### üîê Auth - CreateToken

Need to update or delete a booking?  
  
Just generate your **auth token** here and you‚Äôre good to go!  
  
This token gives you secure access to the `PUT` and `DELETE /booking` endpoints. üé´üîí

request.description:
### üõèÔ∏è Booking - Create a Booking

Creates a new booking in the API Request.  
This is an HTTP POST request to create a new booking. The request body should be in raw JSON format üìã‚ú®

---

#### üì¨ Endpoint

``` bash
POST /booking

 ```

---

#### üìù Request Body (JSON)

Send a JSON object with the following fields:

``` json
{
  "firstname": "John",
  "lastname": "Doe",
  "totalprice": 150,
  "depositpaid": true,
  "bookingdates": {
    "checkin": "2025-05-08",
    "checkout": "2025-05-12"
  },
  "additionalneeds": "Breakfast"
}

 ```

**Fields:**

- `firstname` (string): Guest's first name
    
- `lastname` (string): Guest's last name
    
- `totalprice` (number): Total booking price
    
- `depositpaid` (boolean): Whether the deposit is paid
    
- `bookingdates` (object): Includes `checkin` and `checkout` dates
    
- `additionalneeds` (string): Any extra requests (e.g., "Breakfast", "Late checkout")
    

---

#### üì¶ Response

A successful response returns a JSON object with the booking ID and booking details:

``` json
{
  "bookingid": 1234,
  "booking": {
    "firstname": "John",
    "lastname": "Doe",
    "totalprice": 150,
    "depositpaid": true,
    "bookingdates": {
      "checkin": "2025-05-08",
      "checkout": "2025-05-12"
    },
    "additionalneeds": "Breakfast"
  }
}

 ```

---

üìÖ **Time to book it and bring in those guests!** üõéÔ∏è

request.description:
### ‚úèÔ∏è Booking - UpdateBooking

This endpoint lets you **update an existing booking** with new guest info, updated dates, or even extra needs like breakfast or a late checkout. üß≥üõéÔ∏è

---

#### üì¨ Endpoint

Replace `:id` with the unique ID of the booking you'd like to update.

---

#### üìù Request Body

The request should include the full set of booking details in JSON format:

**Fields:**

| Field | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `firstname` | string | ‚úÖ | Guest‚Äôs first name |
| `lastname` | string | ‚úÖ | Guest‚Äôs last name |
| `totalprice` | number | ‚úÖ | Total price for the booking |
| `depositpaid` | boolean | ‚úÖ | Indicates if the deposit has been paid |
| `bookingdates` | object | ‚úÖ | Includes `checkin` and `checkout` dates |
| `additionalneeds` | string | ‚ùå | Optional special requests |

---

#### üì¶ Response

Upon success, the response will confirm the updated booking details, including the booking ID and the new data:

---

üìã **Need to fix a name, change dates, or update a price?** This endpoint makes it smooth and simple to keep your bookings up-to-date! ‚úÖüóìÔ∏è

request.description:
StartFragment

### üóëÔ∏è Booking - DeleteBooking

Time to say goodbye to a reservation? This endpoint allows you to **delete a specific booking** by simply passing its ID in the URL. Clean, quick, and final. üí•

---

#### üì¨ Request

- **Method:** `DELETE`
    
- **URL Format:**
    

``` bash
https://{{URL}}/booking/:id
 ```

Replace `:id` with the booking ID you want to remove.

üì≠ **Request Body:**

No request body is needed ‚Äî just the ID in the URL.

---

#### üì¶ Response

When the deletion is successful, you‚Äôll receive:

- **Status:** `201 Created`
    
- **Content-Type:** `text/plain`
    
- Body:
    

``` bash
Created

 ```

üöÄ Whether it‚Äôs a cancellation or cleanup, this endpoint helps you keep things tidy and up-to-date. Let me

item.description:
### üìã Booking - Get All Bookings

Want the full guest list? üéüÔ∏è  
  
This endpoint returns the **IDs of all bookings** in the system!  
  
You can also add optional query strings to filter and fetch just the bookings you're looking for. üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è‚ú®

request.description:
### üõéÔ∏è GET /ping

Need to check if the service is up and running? This endpoint is your friendly **health check** ‚Äî like knocking on the server‚Äôs door to make sure it‚Äôs home. üè†üîç

---

#### üì¨ Request

- **Method:** `GET`
    
- arduinoŸÜÿ≥ÿÆÿ™ÿ≠ÿ±Ÿäÿ±https://{{URL}}/ping
    
- **Request Body:**  
      
    None required ‚Äî just send the request and wait for a response.
    

---

#### üì¶ Response

| Property | Value |
| --- | --- |
| **Status** | `201 Created` |
| **Content-Type** | `text/plain` |
| **Body** | `Created` |

---

#### üßæ Response Body Schema

``` bash
{
  "type": "string"
}

 ```

---

üì° Whether you're setting up monitoring or just double-checking availability, this simple ping gives you peace of mind that the API is alive and ready to serve!

item.description:
### üì° GET /ping ‚Äî Service Check

Feeling curious? Give the API a little _ping_! üõéÔ∏è
